Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student is able to accurately identify and illustrate both a land habitat (such as a forest) and a water habitat (such as a pond) with clear distinctions between the two.
The student can draw and label a variety of plants in each habitat, demonstrating an understanding of plant diversity, such as trees and shrubs in the forest and water plants in the pond.
The student is capable of drawing and labeling diverse animals appropriate for each habitat, such as squirrels and deer in the forest and frogs and fish in the pond.
The student successfully illustrates and compares the differences in plant and animal types between the two habitats, highlighting unique and contrasting elements.
The student observes and identifies patterns of living things in each habitat, showing an understanding of ecological diversity and environmental adaptation.
CANNOT: The student might occasionally overlook the labeling of some smaller or less noticeable organisms (e.g., insects or small aquatic plants) due to oversight, not misunderstanding.

There may be minor inaccuracies in proportional representation, such as slightly misrepresenting the size of an animal relative to its real-world counterpart, but these do not detract from overall understanding.
